chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Perry S Koeppen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Program.
Court grants 391 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by the Agent.
No contact with: the Victim, Victim's parents, anyone under the age of 18 years old.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.
Sex Offender treatment.
Register as a Sex Offender.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Perry S Koeppen

records.addlTxt:
Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin, by zoom.
Defendant Perry S Koeppen in court, by phone.
Victim's father appeared in court.
Court to Address:  Defendant's request for sentence modification - To allow him to attend a wedding (with minor children) with a a chaperone.  

State objects to any modification of the sentence/conditions - Arguments presented.
Victim's father presented statements to the court - Objects to the request.
Defendant presented statements to the court.

Court finds there is no new factor to modify the sentence as originally ordered by Judge Aprahamian.
Therefore, court denies the defendant's request for Sentence Modification.
Motion hearing on August 25, 2020 at 02:45 pm.

Defense objects to the PSI and files reports from Doctors with the Court. Reports to be sealed and not opened without Court's permission. Court will not order a PSI. State to advise if the next date is not convenient for the victims and obtain another date for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
